text: Mark Charles Teixeira (born April 11, 1980) plays American Major League Baseball. He has played first and third bases and the outfield. He was born in Annapolis, Maryland. He played college ball for Georgia Tech. In 2001 he won the Dick Howser Trophy as the national collegiate baseball player of the year. He has played professsional ball with the Texas Rangers, the Atlanta Braves, Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim, and the New York Yankees. Teixeira is of Portuguese-American descent. He, his wife, and their three children live in Greenwich, Connecticut. He likes hunting, fishing, golfing, and reading. He is a Christian and likes Broadway musicals. ==References== Category:Living people Category:1980 births Category:American baseball players Category:Atlanta Braves players Category:New York Yankees players Category:People from Annapolis, Maryland Category:Sportspeople from Maryland Category:Texas Rangers players Category:Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim players
title: Mark Teixeira
